intro: Rhexia campanularis, commonly known as the bellflower heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in forested areas, often in the understory of pine or hardwood forests. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Rhexia campanularis is a perennial herb that thrives in partial shade and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
